page.title: 18Where We Live
page.content: Around where I live there are lots of houses on estates but there are lots of trees and open spaces too.There are quite a lot of oak trees around here but not many elms now because Dutch Elm Disease has killed them all off.When we go out to play after school we can go down to the park at Malpas.They have got tennis courts and cricket pitches there as well as swings.Just past there is the River Fal and ships come up it to bring wood and sand to U.B.M.Harvey but they have to be careful because the river is full of med and if they go the wrong way they could get stuck.There is a dredger ship which is usually moored by Penroses and that scrapes up the mud to keep the river clear.You can catch all sorts of fish in the Fal but you need a licence or the Water Bailif will take your rod.
